Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Partecipazione in qualita' di referee anonimo alle seguenti riviste nazionali e internazionali: Acta Sociologica, International Sociology (2016), Social Movement Studies (2015), Mobilization, Partecipazione e Conflitto, Communication, Culture and Critique, International Journal of Comparative Sociology, European Political Science Review (2013), Partecipazione e Conflitto, Triple-C (2012), Journal of Internet Technologies and Politics, West European Politics (2011), British Journal of Sociology (2010), Partecipazione e Conflitto, Millenium and Interface (2009), OberCom (2008), Polis (2007).

Partecipazione alla collana Globalizzazione, Partecipazione, Movimenti della casa editrice Franco Angeli. Ruolo di editor per il trattato collettaneo Alla ricerca dell'Onda. I nuovi conflitti nell'istruzione superiore, (con Loris Caruso , Alberta Giorgi e Gianni Piazza)

Partecipazione alla Collana Studies in European Political Science Series della casa editrice ECPR. Ruolo di editor per il trattato collettaneo Spreading Protest. Social Movements in Times of Crisis (con Donatella della Porta)
Membro del comitato editoriale della rivista Partecipazione e Conflitto, Rivista di Fascia A nei settori disciplinari 14/C1, 14/C2, 14/C3 e 14/D1.
Partecipazione alla collana Globalizzazione, partecipazione, movimenti della casa editrice Franco Angeli. Ruolo di referee anonimo.
Partecipazione al programma Hardback Monograph della casa editrice Routledge. Ruolo di referee anonimo.
Membro del comitato editoriale della collana Democrazie e Conflitti, Mimesis-Meltemi Editore

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Relatrice su invito. Contributo “Transnational Public Spaces in Movement. Why they Matter for Democracy in the EU and how they Transform the Public Space”. Workshop of the “Contesting Euro Vision Project”. University of Technology, Sydney, Australia.
Relatrice. Contributo “Serpica Naro and the others. The Social Media Experience in Italian Precarious Workers Struggles”. OURMedia VII International Conference. University of Technology, Sydney.

Relatrice. Contributo “The Euromayday Parade Against Precarity: Cross-national Diffusion and Transformation of the European Space ‘from Below’” (con Nicole Doerr). Workshop for Young Scholars on “Campaign Analysis in a Globalizing World”. Geschwister-Scholl-Institute of Political Science, LMU Munich.

Relatrice. Contributo “Beyond Mainstream and Independent Media: The ‘social media’ Experience”. Conferenza dell'International Association of Media and Communication Research (IAMCR) Conference. UNESCO, Paris.

Relatrice. Contributo “Tra consenso e conflitto. Pratiche mediatiche nei movimenti italiani contro la precarietà del lavoro”. XXI Congresso della Società Italiana di Scienze Politiche (SISP). Università di Catania.

Relatrice su invito. Contributo “Protest movements between face-to-face interactions and computer-mediated-communication”. Workshop of the Research Project ‘Changing Protest and Media Cultures’ on “Webcampaigning @ public sphere(s). Collaborative Research Centre ‘Media Upheavals’, Siegen University, Germany.

Relatrice. “Reconsidering the European Public Sphere. Media for Collective Action in the Euro Babel”. Thematic Workshop of the JCER Journal. Media and Communication in Europe Research Group of the UACES. University of Bristol.

Relatrice. Contributo “ICTs in national and transnational mobilizations”, Doctoral Students Meeting of the ICT&S Center for Advanced Studies and Research in Information and Communication Technologies & Society. University of Salzburg.

Relatrice. Contributo "From "Refusal of Work" to "Basic Income". Patterns of Transformation in Discourses About Work: From Italian Social Movements of the 70's to European Protest Campaigns Against Precarity". Summer School Confronting Cold War Conformity: Peace and Protest Cultures in Europe, 1945-1989 organized by the Marie Curie research network European Protest Movements since 1945. Charles Prague University.

Relatrice. Contributo “Reconsidering Frame Analysis from a Visual Perspective in Social Movements Studies”. Workshop Studying the Political through Frame Analysis. European Consortium for Political Research (ECPR) Joint Session, Lisbon University Institute, Lisbon.

Relatrice. Contributo “Sympathetic media and social movements. Some evidence from the cycle of protest against precarity in Italy”. 9th Conference of the European Sociological Association (ESA). University of Lisbon.

Relatrice. Contributo “Commercial 'Participatory Web' Platforms and Communication Repertoire of Italian Social Centers” (con Matteo Cernison). XXIII Congresso della Società Italiana di Scienze Politiche (SISP). LUISS, Roma.
Relatrice. Contributo “Activist Media Practices and Communication Repertoire in Complex Media Environments”. MeCCSA Conference. London School of Economics, London.

Relatrice su invito. Contributo “Images and protest through the lenses of the frame analysis approach”. KFG Workshop The Contentious Face of European Politics: Towards an Analysis of Discursive and Visual Strategies of Transnational Diffusion. Freie Universität Berlin, Germany.

Relatrice su invito. Contributo “Struggles of Recognition and Redistribution in Europe. Old and New Workers Movement in the European Arena(s) of Contestation”. Arenas of Contestation Workshop. Heidelberg Centre for American Studies, Heidelberg University.

Relatrice su invito. Contributo “Precarious workers struggles in Italy and the state of democracy”. Seminario Democratic Futures? Democracy beyond the UK, Debate on alternative reference-points for democratic change, from Latin America, Europe and elsewhere. Goldsmiths, University of London.

Relatrice. Contributo “Perceptions, representations and interactions in multiple activist media practices. The case of italian mobilizations against precarity of work”. International Association of Media and Communication Research (IAMCR)Conference. University of Minho, Braga.

Relatrice su invito. Contributo “Between Allies and Opponents. Sympathetic Media and Social Movements”. Weekly Seminar of the Media and Movement Research and Action Project (MRAP). Boston College, USA.
Relatrice su invito. Contributo “Communication Repertoires in Social Movements Processes”. Workshop on Power, Resistance and Social Change. Department of Sociology, University of Pittsburgh, USA.
Relatrice su invito. Contributo “Grassroots Politics and Alternative Media in the Making of Europe". European Colloquium Series. Department of History, University of Pittsburgh, USA.

Relatrice su invito. Contributo “Precarious knowledge. Notes from a co-research on flexibility on Italian universities”. Tavola rotonda “The University in Crisis”. Conferenza della International Association of Media and Communication Research (IAMCR), Kadir Has University, Istanbul.

Relatrice. “Online Communication Repertoires in Electoral Campaigning 2.0 – The Case of 2010 Italian Regional Elections” (con Giovanna Mascheroni). European Consortium for Political Research (ECPR) General Conference. University of Iceland.

Organizzatrice della sezione ‘Contentious Politics in Times of Crisis” durante la European Consortium for Political Research (ECPR) General Conference. University of Iceland, Reykjavík, Iceland. Sezione comprendente 8 Panel.

Partecipante su invito. Workshop "Understanding the New Wave of Social Cooperation: Triangulation of Arab revolutions, European mobilizations and the American Occupy Movement". Berkman Centre, Harvard University, USA.
Promotrice e organizzatrice della conferenza internazionale “The Seasons of the Arab Springs”, University of Pittsburgh, USA.

Relatrice su invito. Contributo “Towards a more nuanced role of Facebook in Occupy Wall Street”, Workshop on Social Movements in Times of Financial Crises. Department of Political and Social Sciences, European University Institute, Italy.
Relatrice. Contributo “Rizhomatic spaces of struggle in Occupy Wall Street”. 4th National STS Italy conference. Rovigo.

Relatrice su invito. Contributo “Struggles of Precarious Workers in Italy and Greece" (con Markos Vogiatzoglou). Workshop From Silence to Protest: International Perspectives on Weakly Resourced Groups. University of Limerick.
Relatrice su invito. Presentazione del volume “Media Practices and Protest Politics: How Precarious Workers Mobilize”. Department of Sociology, University of Pittsburgh, USA.

Relatrice. “Unconventional Political Participation of Young Precarious Workers. A comparative perspective on Italy and Greece” (con Markos Vogiatzoglou). Workshop Giovani e Mercato del Lavoro: instabilità, transizioni, partecipazione, politiche. Università di Bologna.

Direttrice del workshop “The Transnational Dimension of Protest: From the Arab Spring to Occupy Wall Street” durante le European Consortium for Political Research (ECPR) Joint Sessions, Johannes Gutenberg Universitat, Mainz, Germany.

Relatrice. Contributo “I post, you tweet, she chats... and we all occupy. Spaces of communication and participation in Occupy Pittsburgh”. Conferenza Annuale della International Communication Association. London, UK.
Relatrice su invito. Discussant alla tavola rotonda "Understanding Contemporary Waves of Protest". 20th International Conference of Europeanists. University of Amsterdam, Amsterdam.
Organizzatrice della sezione Research Network on Social Movements durante la European Sociological Association General Conference, Università di Torino, Torino, Italia

Organizzatrice della sezione “Comparative Perspectives on the New Politics of Dissent” durante la European Consortium for Political Research (ECPR) General Conference, University of Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France. Sezione composta da 8 Panels.

Relatrice. Contributo “Civil Society Actors Fighting Against Political Corruption in Italy. A Pilot Study on 'Senza la Corruzione... Riparte il Futuro'” (con Donatella della Porta). European Consortium for Political Research (ECPR) General Conference. University of Bordeaux.

Direttrice della Summer School on Methods for the Study of Political Participation and Mobilization sostenuta da Centre on Social Movement Studies (COSMOS) e European Consortium for Political Research (ECPR). European University Institute, Florence, Italy.
Organizzatrice del workshop “Bringing Capitalism Back in Social Movement Studies”, European University Institute, Florence, Italy.

Relatrice su invito. Contributo “Andare oltre il sindacato? Le mobilitazioni dei lavoratori precari in Italia prima e dopo la crisi economica”. Seminario “Diffusione del Lavoro Atipico e Crisi della Rappresentanza Sindacale”. Dipartimento di Scienze Sociali, Università degli Studi di Napoli Federico II.

Keynote Speaker con il contributo “Media practices, mediation and mediatization in the study of ICTs and social movements. Some theoretical and methodological reflections” durante l'Open Day of Studies: Collective Action and ICTs. Centre d’Études sur les Médias, les Technologies et l’Internationalisation, Paris 8.

Lezione seminariale su invito. Argomento del seminario "Movimenti Sociali e Anti-mafia dal Basso". Master in Analisi, Prevenzione e Contrasto della Criminalità Organizzata e della Corruzione . Anno Accademico 2014-2015. Università di Pisa. Seminario di 4 ore.

Organizzatrice del seminario "Mobilisations, Changing Protest Cultures and Web 2.0 Technologies" per la serie di seminari ESRC "Social Movements and Media Technologies", in collaborazione con Goldsmiths, University of London e Centre on Social Movement Studies, Istituto di Scienze Umane, Scuola Normale Superiore.

Relatrice. Contributo “Media Ecologies: A Review, an Assessment and a Typology for the Study of Protest Movements” (con Emiliano Treré). Conferenza Internazionale Protest Participation in Variable Media Ecologies. Università di Alghero.

Relatrice. Contributo "The Role of ICTs in Anti-Austerity Protest Media Ecologies: A Comparative Analysis of Communication Flows in Southern Europe" (con Sandra Jeppensen). 22nd International Conference of Europeanists. Sciences Po, Paris.
Relatrice su invito. Workshop per Young Scholars on Publishing on Social Movements: Strategies, Choices, and Challenges. 22nd International Conference of Europeanists. Sciences Po, Paris.

Organizzatrice del seminario "Visibilities: Social Protest, ‘The Media’, and the Shaping of Public Opinion" per la serie di seminari ESRC "Social Movements and Media Technologies", in collaborazione con Goldsmiths, University of London e Centre on Social Movement Studies, Istituto di Scienze Umane, Scuola Normale Superiore.
Direttrice della COSMOS/ECPR Summer School on Methods for the Study of Political Participation and Mobilization, Scuola Normale Superiore/European University Institute, Italia.

Organizzatrice del seminario "The Activist, the Academic and Digital Media: Challenging Research, Re-thinking Theory" per la serie di seminari ESRC "Social Movements and Media Technologies", in collaborazione con Goldsmiths, University of London e Centre on Social Movement Studies, Istituto di Scienze Umane, Scuola Normale Superiore.

Organizzatrice del seminario "The Missing Actor: The Meaning of Political Cultures for Media/Movements Interactions" per la serie di seminari ESRC "Social Movements and Media Technologies", in collaborazione con Goldsmiths, University of London e Centre on Social Movement Studies, Istituto di Scienze Umane, Scuola Normale Superiore.

Relatrice. Contributo "The role of alternative media in Italian, Spanish and Greek anti-austerity movements". Anti-Austerity and Media Activism - International Association of Media and Communication Research (IAMCR) 2016 Pre-Conference. Goldsmiths, University of London.

Lezione seminariale su invito. Argomento del seminario "Sociologia dei Movimenti Sociali". Master in Master in “Criminologia critica e sicurezza sociale, devianza, città e politiche di prevenzione”. Anno Accademico 2015-2016. Università di Padova. Seminario di 4 ore.

Relatrice su invito. Tavola rotonda di discussione del volume The Oxford Handbook of Social Movements. Mid-Term Conference del Research Network Social Movements della European Sociological Association, Istituto di Scienze Umane e Sociali, Scuola Normale Superiore.
Relatrice. Contributo "The (media) infrastructure of protest participation in Occupy Wall Street". Workshop on Materiality, Publicness and Digital Media. University of Amsterdam.

Relatrice. Contributo "A Media Ecology Approach to Understand Patterns of Political Communication and Participation in Italy, Spain and Greece". 6th European Communication Conference - ECREA Association. Prague.

Organizzatrice del seminario "The Subversion of Big Data. Cultures, Discourses and Practices of Big Data in Social Movements Contexts" per la serie di seminari ESRC "Social Movements and Media Technologies", in collaborazione con Goldsmiths, University of London e Centre on Social Movement Studies, Istituto di Scienze Umane, Scuola Normale Superiore.

Ciclo XXX e XXXI di dottorato in Scienze Politiche, e Sociologia, Anno Accademico 2015/2016, Secondo Semestre. Corso di 20 ore.

Docente del corso obbligatorio Methodology IV - Intro to Qualitative Methods per il ciclo di dottorato Istituto di Scienze Umane e Sociali, Scuola Normale Superiore. Ciclo XXXII del dottorato in Scienze Politiche e Sociologia, Anno Accademico 2016/2017, Primo Semestre. Corso di 20 ore.

Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: Assistente di Ricerca, Toronto University. Progetto di ricerca “Familialistic Welfare States in Transition” su fondi Social Sciences And Humanities Research Council Of Canada (SSHRC). Responsabile scientifico Ito Peng, School of Public Policy and Governance, Toronto University.

Assistente di Ricerca, University of Technology Sydney. Progetto di ricerca “Contact Zones: art, media and activism in Italy, 1994-2006” su fondi ARC Discovery Project Grant, in Australia. Responsabile scientifico Ilaria Vanni, Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences, University of Technology Sydney.

Assistente di ricerca, Istituto Universitario Europeo. Progetto di ricerca "Anticorrp - Global Trends and European Responses to the Challenge of Corruption" su fondi della Commissione Europea, Settimo Programma Quadro. Responsabile scientifico Donatella della Porta, Istituto Universitario Europeo.

Collaboratrice alla ricerca, Memorial University, Canada. Progetto di ricerca "Oil-Tourism Interface and Social-Ecological Change in the North Atlantic" su fondi Social Sciences And Humanities Research Council Of Canada (SSHRC). Responsabile scientifico Mark Stoddart, Memorial University, Canada.

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: Partecipazione alle attività del gruppo di ricerca internazionale “European Protest Movement Since the Cold War”, Finanziamento VII Programma Quadro della Commissione Europea. Responsabile scientifico, Martin Klimke, New York University.

Membro del gruppo di ricerca “Political Online e Nuovi Media” all'Istituto Cattaneo, Bologna. Coordinatore del gruppo di ricerca, Lorenzo Mosca, Scuola Normale Superiore, Istituto di Scienze Umane e Sociali, Firenze.
Direzione dello Standing Group Standing Group Participation and Mobilization, European Consortium for Political Research (ECPR).

Partecipazione alle attività del gruppo di ricerca internazionale "Centre on Social Movement Studies (COSMOS)", European University Institute (2012-2015) e Scuola Normale Superiore (dal 2015). Direttrice, Donatella Della Porta, Scuola Normale Superiore

Partecipazione alle attività del gruppo di ricerca internazionale "Anticorrp - Global Trends and European Responses to the Challenge of Corruption" su fondi della Commissione Europea, Settimo Programma Quadro. Responsabile scientifico Monika Bahur, The Quality of Government Institute, University of Gothenburg

Responsabilita' scientifica per progetti.content: Responsabile scientifico del progetto di ricerca “Protest Media Ecologies: Communicative Affordances for Social Change in the Digital Era” (con Sandra Jeppensen), Lakehead University, Orilia, Canada e Istituto di Scienze Umane e Sociali, Scuola Normale Superiore, Firenze, Italia. Fondi del Social Science and Humanities Research Council - Insight Development Grant, in Canada. Grant number 430-2014-00181. Fondi totali gestiti: 69.995 Dollari Canadesi.

Responsabile scientifico dei Seminari di Ricerca "Social Movements and Media Technologies" (con Veronica Barassi), Goldsmiths, University of London e Istituto di Scienze Umane e Sociali, Scuola Normale Superiore. Fondi di Economic and Social Research Council (UK). Fondi totali gestiti: 29.000 Sterline inglesi.

Direttrice e responsabile scientifico (Principal Investigator) del progetto di ricerca "PiCME - Political participation in Complex Media Environments" all'Istituto di Scienze Umane e Sociali, Scuola Normale Superiore su fondi MIUR, programma SIR - Scientific Independence for Young Researchers. Grant Number E52I15000500001. Totale fondi gestiti: 408.100 Euro
